item.title: Bayesian methods for addressing missing data in health economic evaluations
A Bayesian Parametric Approach to Handle Missing Longitudinal Outcome Data in Trial-Based Health Economic Evaluations
Bayesian Statistical Economic Evaluation Methods for Health Technology Assessment
A Full Bayesian Model to Handle Structural Ones and Missingness in Economic Evaluations from Individual-Level Data
A Full Bayesian Model to Handle Structural Ones and Missingness in Health Economic Evaluations from Individual-Level Data
missingHE
item.description:
The focus of this simple tutorial is to provide a brief introduction and overview about how to fit Bayesian models using STAN via R.

Prerequisites:

  • The latest version of R, which can be downloaded and installed for Windows, Mac or Linux OS from the CRAN website
  • I also strongly recommend to download and install Rstudio, an integrated development environment which provides an “user-friendly” interaction with R (e.g. many drop-down menus, tabs, customisation options)
